meanings.definition: A short, low-pitched sound or noise.
meanings.sent1: I heard tiny bloops coming from the pond.
meanings.sent2: The bloops of the baby's laughter filled the room.
meanings.sent3: The bloops of the old car horn made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The bloops of the raindrops on the roof sounded like a gentle melody.
meanings.sent5: The bloops of the bubbles popping in the fizzy drink were delightful.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally bloopsed the spelling of that word.
meanings.sent2: She always bloops when trying to juggle too many tasks.
meanings.sent3: He bloopsed by wearing mismatched socks to the important meeting.
meanings.sent4: The comedian intentionally bloopsed his punchline for comedic effect.
meanings.sent5: Don't bloops your lines during the play!

meanings.definition: A series of mistakes or errors.
meanings.sent1: The project was full of bloops from start to finish.
meanings.sent2: Her speech was filled with embarrassing bloops.
meanings.sent3: The bloops in the recipe turned the cake into a funny disaster.
meanings.sent4: The bloops in his logic led to a chain of unfortunate events.
meanings.sent5: The bloops in the plan caused chaos and confusion.
